titleStmt.title: Description of Columbia University. MS Or 389: Hādhā ḥijāb ʻaẓīm al-shaʼn wa-al-burhān.

msContents.summary: Copy of a small devotional book with prayers and incantations for luck and health. In another copy, the text is attributed to Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī al-Būnī.

supportDesc.extent: 42 leaves : 110 x 80 (80 x 55) mm, bound to 114 x 92 mm

layoutDesc.layout: 8 or 9 long lines; catchwords every verso, lower left.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in informal naskh in black ink; pointed.

decoNote: Textblock border-ruled in double red; overlining in red.

binding.p: Brown leather over pasteboard with flap; blind-stamped, long central cartouche and cornerpieces that meet along the long edges, with paper onlays; remnants of blue paper doublure with gilt stamped pattern of flowers and stems inside crossing diagonal lines.

origin.p: Item is undated, probably produced in the 19th century.
